intro: Ginoria flava, commonly known as the yellow ginoria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year, making it an attractive addition to gardens. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Ginoria flava is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit.
